title: First Blog post! Process of implementing a dark theme
content:
HTML files: 
<i class="bi bi-brightness-high-fill" id="toggleDark"></i>
 I wanted an icon to represent a dark & light theme, bootstrap has a built-in icon for this, where you just copy and paste the exact web/icon font on their website, to utilize their icon.
JavaScript files: 
 When the icon is clicked, the function checks if 'bi-brightness-high-fill' is present, which indicates the sun. If it is, the theme switches to light mode. Through changing the body background colours, text colours, and a transition effect. And vice versa for dark mode. To save the theme across pages, the theme is stored in localStorage.

title: Making a dynamic blog
content: In a JSON file, I created three objects for a blog post, title, date, and content. I then created a script that fetches the JSON file (posts.json) and parses posts.json into a JavaScript object of posts, this iterates through each blog post. Inside the for loop, a list item is created, and constructs the HTML for each blog post (h2 for title, p for date & content). Lastly, the catch() is for error handling if any error occurs during the fetch() operation.
